page.title: 14More on housing.
page.content: Council houses were built along the Warwick Road between-wars. More Council house and private building has gone on behind this earlier development. In the 1960's, between Warwick and Gelt Road a large estate of council houses and flats were built.{The {estate is locally known as 'Jerusalem' {because, with its pale yellow brick {and flat roofs it resembles housing in {Palestine.}The flats are occupied by elderly retired people. A new private estate is now under construction behind Front Street, Brampton. Milton has grown little, with only the addition of a few council houses and a row of old peoples homes. In Farlam, two stone built barns have been converted into dwellings and a few modern houses added to the small community.
